subject: Re: [junit] using abstract classes to test interfaces
msgSnippet: I see some error which may be causing it... but perhaps this was just careless typing. ... The setUp method should look like: public void setUp() throws
messageBody:
I see some error which may be causing it... but perhaps this was just careless
typing.

> public class TestWidget extends TestCase {
> public abstract Widget getWidget();
> private Wiget toTest;
> protected Widget setup(){
> toTest = getWidget();
> }

The setUp method should look like:

public void setUp() throws Exception {
...
}

>
> public testOne(){
> toTest.doSometing();
> }
> }

Test methods should look like:

public void testXXX() {
...
}

=====
-----------------------------------------
Keep it simple...
(1 Corinthians 2:2, Galatians 2:20, 6:14)
